main event: Radar detected 6-12 unidentified flying objects near Merced, California, on April 10, 1964.
interesting points: The objects were picked up on radar at altitudes of 60,000 ft and higher,The F-106 jets scrambled for identification but could not maintain radar lock-on,Two additional U-2 type aircraft were sent for investigation,Objects appeared to be following a near-track pattern,Initial identification suggested they could be balloons, but confirmation was pending.
witness description: no direct witnesses reported as it was primarily a radar observation
